title: Spell Vamp illaoi
body:
OK, i'll be honest, i bet you 5 bucks right now that you have clicked on this and thought what the actual fuck ??, i bet you are probably thinking that i am really stupid for having this as my build for illaoi

BUT ..... Let me explain myself as to why i build this on illaoi

{{item:3812}} {{item:3146}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3074}} {{item:3006}} 

And now you are probably thinking that i'm even dumber for buying an item to which the champ has no AP scaling abilities at all

So let me explain..

See with the current build it's the standard {{item:3071}} {{item:3748}} then tank items,
and as most of you know that Illaoi's Q heals for 5% of her missing health IF it hits an enemy champ
So i just thought i wonder how good spell vamp Illaoi would be ?
So for one game i built these items and i have never looked back

Now i know some people don't like math so let me sum it up for those people

Basically with Death's Dance, Hextech and Spirit Visage passive's you get a massive amount of healing from a single q now, instead of getting that weak shit 5% if it hits a champ,
heal from what ever now and now receive around 400 - 500 per minion in a single q

but here is the math

Lets say i have 2100 HP as my max health and am currently sitting on lets say 500 HP
and because i have all the items built lets say i do 870 dmg to minions with q

With the 15% ( +33% of that healing because of AOE )  from Death's Dance and Hextech Gunblade, this would mean off of 870 dmg  p/m  15% ( 130.5 ) + 33% ( 43.065 ) = 173.565 plus a bonus 20% on top of that because of Spirit Visage's passive, so 173.565 + 20% 
( 34.713 ) = 208.278 in healing just from Death's Dance, this is would then be doubled because the same effect occurs on Hextech Gunblade therefore is would be 173.565 x 2 
( 347.13 ) + 20% ( 69.426 ) = 416.556.
In one single Q on illaoi, you would heal 416.556 health without her passive on her q and this is applied per minion, because it stacks if you hit 8 minions in a single q ( which is possible as shown in the video ), healing  up to 1000 - 1500 HP ( i did 416.556 x 8 on the calculator and i got 3,332.448, never once have i ever been healed for that amount hense why im saying you can only heal between 1000 - 1500 HP because it is the highest i have seen/recorded at )

Now apply that healing  to her W, E and her Ult. If you were to land a 5 man ult and then continue to fight them you would be granted around 1600 Healing because the passive on illaoi's q give 5% bonus healing for each champ hit,  but the point is that you would be almost be able to heal yourself to max health with 2 rounds of tentacle slaps when you ult.

Now i challenge you to try this build out for fun :D

No runes or mastery changes are needed but if you tried this and did enjoy it
and wanna try it with all runes and shit, there are two variations to these runes and masteries

for Runes you want 

Set 1 :

- Attack Damage Marks
- Armour Per Level Seals
- Magic Resist Per Level Glyphs 
- Spell Vamp Quints

Set 2 :
- Attack Damage Marks
- Armour Per Level Seals
- Attack Speed Glyphs
- Spell Vamp Quints

and run 12 - 18 - 0  taking thunderlords as your keystone
or run 18 - 12 - 0 taking Fevour as your keystone

Also if you get super fed from your enemies and already have the full build and still want to change some items around

then sell {{item:3071}} {{item:3006}}  and get {{item:3033}} {{item:3046}} / another attack speed item, preferable is phatom dance because it grants movespeed, crit change, and a big attack speed bonus

Reason to why you would get Mortal reminder instead of Lord Dominik's Regards, is because with the full build you have 3K HP, and the change of getting an enemy with less HP then that is pretty slim. 

I am willing to prove this via a youtube video if people would prefer it to be seen as proof
if so i will use instances in a norms match, but only by request

EDIT 1 :

- Math has been changed after being explained that the passive's from death's dance do 15% + 33% of that healing, instead of a flat 33%

- An extra set of runes and masteries has been added

- Added what happens if you get super fed, and want to change items

- General grammer checking

EDIT 2 : Here is the link for the Video : https://youtu.be/jFIE69pXKog

Few things to note :

- I'm not very good at making videos like this, so forgive me for my bad video editing skills

- It's short, plus i tried hard to prolong the norms games so i could get full build, but the game would end before i could, so i VS'ed Bots just so i could quickly get a full build to show you guys, sorry bout that :)

- The quality of the video isn't all that good either, so sorry about it :)

Ok, so i suppose you point out the problems with my build, when really there are no real big problems, the only real big problem with this build is if you fight hard cc, you wouldn't need armour because of the healing you would get, and yes some fights will be pretty tight, but 70% of the time ( depending on who you are fighting ), you will win straight out because you have more healing, sorry that i lashed out, it just seemed like that just because i was in bronze and i am bad at the game, you just gave me shit about it, and my build, yes while some people will say there are problems, there really isn't just depends on who you are fighting, tbh, even if you fight Teemo you still win with this build

Let's be honest, how many games do you get in where there is no hard CC?

And no i meant nothing about you actually being bronze, i'm just saying that does mean a slight lack of knowledge in your opponents (I have done a lot of odd builds in bronze, and no one notices ever, AD Malz and have the enemy building MR for example)

Surprisely, there are very few game where there is hard cc, for example if you are in a 3v1 with an ahri thats enough to throw you off and get yourself killed, but the changes of you fighting some with hard cc is pretty low, tbh you probably will get the occasional cc top lane, but that cc from that champ what ever champ it is will not be enough to kill you, early game yea maybe if you are low enough they could kill you, other then that not really a lot of challenging picks, well reguarding your point about lack of enemy knowledge, for illaoi it probably won't make a difference but unless they notice like i have had a few people point out in the most recent of my games, i have had people ask  " Why do i rush Death's Dance ? " or even have been told " wtf is that ??? ", so yea maybe im not 100% sure on that one tbh

Well lets see.

Using pick rate from here: http://www.lolking.net/champions

Top pick rate champs that have hard CC: Thresh (33%), Lux (21%), Morgana (20%), Malphite (16%), Ahri (15%), Poppy (14.4%)

I think you get the idea, now sure in bronze there is less chance of hard CC, but it still exists on so many champions that it's really hard to find a champion that doesn't have some form of hard CC (outside of no CC champions).

EDIT: In fact i decided to have a quicklook at your match history, using only games on illaoi to check how many  of your enemies have hard CC.
0 forms of hard CC: **0**
1 form of hard CC: 3
2 forms of hard CC: 8
3+ forms of hard CC: 8

Now each champion could only count for 1 form of hard CC, so a majority of your games had 2 or more champions with hard CC, and not a single game in your last 19 (not counting your Custom) as illaoi, had no champions without hard CC.
